title: Although, However, Though, Despite And In Spite Of

questions.question: He continued to play ........................... the injury.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. It is followed by a noun/pronoun.

questions.question: .............................. he was injured, he continued to play.
questions.description: Though is a conjunction we need a conjunction to connect two clauses.

questions.question: She did not get the job ............................... the fact that she did well in the interview.
questions.description: Either despite or in spite of is possible here.

questions.question: He failed .................................. working hard.
questions.description: We use a preposition before an ing form.

questions.question: He failed .................................. the fact that he worked hard.
questions.description: We use despite or in spite of before a that-clause introduced by the fact.

questions.question: My husband did not like the movie ............................, I enjoyed it a lot.
questions.description: However is a transitional adverb it is used to introduce an idea that contradicts the previous idea.

questions.question: ................................. I was invited to the party, I did not go.
The train was late ............................., I managed to reach on time.
questions.description: However is a transitional adverb it is used to introduce an idea that contradicts the previous idea.

questions.question: ............................... the fact that the train was late, I managed to reach on time.
questions.description: We use despite or in spite of before a that-clause introduced by the fact.

questions.question: ............................. the train was late, I managed to reach on time.
questions.description: Although is a conjunction we use it to connect two clauses.

questions.question: There was no one to help me ............................., I managed to do it.
questions.description: However is a transitional adverb it is used to introduce an idea that contradicts the previous idea.
